thread.title: Arsenal dressing room CLEANED UP by Lincoln City players after 5-0 FA Cup quarter-final defeat at the Emirates
thread.title_full: Arsenal dressing room CLEANED UP by Lincoln City players after 5-0 FA Cup quarter-final defeat at the Emirates

author: ituckey
title: Arsenal dressing room CLEANED UP by Lincoln City players after 5-0 FA Cup quarter-final defeat at the Emirates
text:
EFL HOOVER THE MOON Arsenal dressing room CLEANED UP by Lincoln City players after 5-0 FA Cup quarter-final defeat at the Emirates 
National League leaders again prove they are a class act - asking for a vacuum cleaner after 5-0 loss at the Prem giants By Charlie Wyett 12th March 2017, 10:46 pm Updated: 12th March 2017, 11:46 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FROM the moment they started their fabulous FA Cup run right up to the end at the Emirates, Lincoln have proved they are a class act. 
Despite a 5-0 loss and the fact the entire squad were knackered, they insisted on CLEANING the away dressing room. Lincoln were a class act all the way through their amazing run to the FA Cup quarter-finals and a memorable clash at the Emirates The Sun 6 Lincoln City’s cup run brought in a lot of cash 
Imps staff asked stunned Arsenal officials for a Hoover — they were given a brush — so they could get rid of all the mud on the floor. 
Keep up to date with ALL the FA Cup news 
They also collected all their bottles into a corner. 
Boss Danny Cowley , 38, said: “We always clean the dressing room wherever we go. 
“We conceded at Braintree last season — a terrible goal in a pivotal game for us — and ended up drawing 1-1 but we still swept up. 
“The All Blacks call it ‘sweep the decks’. If it’s good enough for the All Blacks, it’s good enough for us. 
“We always make sure we clean up and leave the changing room as we found it.” 
Cowley has proved to be an impressive character as well as a decent coach. 
You get the impression that along with younger brother Nicky, 35, this is not the last time he will lead a side out in a big game. PA:Press Association 6 Lincoln fans enjoy their big day out despite the 5-0 loss to the Gunners 
Lincoln have an FA Trophy semi-final, first-leg clash against York tomorrow — the second leg is at Sincil Bank on Saturday — with a Wembley appearance up for grabs. 
Cowley added: “We were 90 minutes away from Wembley. It’s about the fourth time we’ve been 90 minutes away and keep coming up short. 
“This wonderful football club has never been to Wembley and you saw those supporters. 
“I did them a disservice in the week because I said they were Premier League but they’re world class. Getty Images Imps boss Danny Cowley reveals their habit of cleaning out dressing rooms following games Arsenal 5-0 Lincoln : Lincoln's FA Cup adventure is now over 
“We have to be inspired by the magnitude of this game and make sure we learn from this Cup journey. 
“We accept we are very quickly going to become fish and chip paper. 
“But if you can’t learn from playing against world-class players, then something’s wrong, isn’t it? 
“People say this is a distraction but it has massively fast-tracked our development as a group.” RELATED STORIES The Night I Killed Klaus The tears flow as Kate continues her evidence CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp in hilarious video after he's interrupted 'THEY ARE TOO STRONG' SunSport experts have their say on Chelsea vs Manchester United as Jose Mourinho looks to avenge drubbing STRIKER CRISIS Wayne Rooney OUT of Chelsea clash after Phil Jones collision - leaving Jose Mourinho with NO fit strikers kane KO Massive blow for Tottenham as injured Harry Kane could be ruled out for rest of the season Mour to come Jose Mourinho believes Marcus Rashford will shine next year after suffering from second season syndrome STARS OF TOMORROW Ryan Sessegnon leads young Championship XI of the season - the shining lights capable of becoming Prem stars No Zlat, no threat Who will step up for Manchester United as they face Chelsea without the suspended Zlatan Ibrahimovic? DANNY HIGGINBOTHAM Marouane Fellaini is Jose Mourinho's best like-for-like alternative for Zlatan Ibrahimovic against Chelsea 'disrespectful' Petr Cech dives in to defend Alexis Sanchez after laughing accusations in Bayern defeat WHiTE HART SHAME Shock moment Millwall fan PUNCHES singing Spurs fan as derby is marred by violence Jor still not fit Jordan Henderson has been ruled out of England's next two matches against Germany and Lithuania 
Lincoln gave a superb account of themselves in the first half before conceding in injury-time. 
Striker Matt Rhead, 32, said: “The goal just before half-time killed us a bit. But they’re a world-class team. 
“They showed us respect and played their best players so you can’t complain.” 
Rhead also enjoyed his battle with Laurent Koscielny — despite getting an elbow in the face. Lincoln City fans celebrate in Covent Garden ahead of their FA Cup clash at Arsenal PA:Press Association Lincoln City star Alan Power shares a joke with Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil during the quarter-final PA:Press Association Adam Marriott gets to the ball ahead of Arsenal superstar Aaron Ramsey 
He said: “It was beautiful. I loved every minute. It was a good battle. 
“I got Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain’s shirt. Their lads were fine, signed things for us and it was a great touch from them. “We want medals round our necks at the end of the season as a reminder of what we’ve achieved. 
“Hopefully, we’ve got Wembley to come and we can put this behind us and sweep it under the carpet.”
